meanings.definition: Institutions of higher education offering a wide range of technical and vocational courses.
meanings.sent1: Many students choose to attend polytechnics to learn practical skills.
meanings.sent2: Polytechnics provide a diverse selection of technical courses for students.
meanings.sent3: The polytechnics in town are like treasure troves of knowledge and skills.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a polytechnics of creativity, constantly producing new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The polytechnics buzzed with activity as students worked on their projects.

meanings.definition: The study of various technical subjects and practical skills.
meanings.sent1: His passion for polytechnics led him to pursue a career in engineering.
meanings.sent2: Studying polytechnics involves hands-on learning and problem-solving.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his brain was a messy polytechnics of jokes and puns.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the city was a vibrant polytechnics of cultures and traditions.
meanings.sent5: The workshop was a lively polytechnics of creativity and innovation.
